The co-pilot of the crashed flight was Andreas Lubitz, who intentionally caused the plane to crash into the French Alps in 2015. He had a history of depression and had been declared unfit to work by a doctor, but had kept this information from the airline. Investigators found evidence that he had researched suicide methods and cockpit door security. Lubitz had locked the pilot out of the cockpit and initiated the plane's descent. The incident raised questions about mental health screening for pilots and cockpit security measures. [1, 2]
